Module WitchHunt
Package fr.sos.witchhunt.model.cards

Class Effect

java.lang.Object
fr.sos.witchhunt.model.cards.Effect
Direct Known Subclasses:
HuntEffect, WitchEffect
public abstract class Effect extends Object

Defines behaviors that are common between Witch? effects and Hunt! effects.

A Rumour card has one Witch? effect and one Hunt! effect (relation of composition).

Effects are supposed to be instantiated as anonymous classes with a redefinition of the perform() for each type of Rumour card.

An effect has a description (used for display), an integer value (used by CPU Players' strategies to make their decisions), a method checking whether the effect is playable in the current situation or not, and a method defining the effects behavior when it is triggered.

Also defines useful methods which are often used by both Witch? effects and Hunt! effects, like taking the next turn, choosing the next player, or getMyself() getting the reference of the Player triggering this effect.

  • Field Details

    • description

      private String description

      The effect's description, which composes the card's display.

      The "/+/" sequence can be added before all lines (but the first one) to make multiline dynamically indented paragraphs.

      See Also:
      • DisplayMediator::displayWitchEffect(RumourCard)
      • DisplayMediator::displayHuntEffect(RumourCard)

    • value

      private int value

      The effect's default integer value. Composes its Rumour card's default value.

      Used by CPU Players' strategies to make their decisions.

      See Also:
      • RumourCard.getDefaultValue()
      • CardValue
      • CPUStrategy

  • Constructor Details

    • Effect

      public Effect(String desc, int value)
      Instantiates an extension of Effect with its description and its integer value.
      Parameters:
      desc - This effect's description. Each "newline" character can be followed by a "/+/" sequence to build multiline, dynamically indented, paragraphs.
      value - This effect's value default value. Corresponds to the value given by a CPU Players' strategies to this effect in its initial state.
      See Also:
      • description
      • value

  • Method Details

    • perform

      public abstract void perform()

      Must be redefined by children classes to define the effect's behavior when it is triggered.

    • isAllowed

      public boolean isAllowed()

      Most effects are playable in any situation.

      However, some, like Pet Newt's Hunt! effect, can only be played at some conditions. Any Rumour card that is playable only at some conditions should redefine this method.

      Returns:
      true if the effect is currently allowed (default), false if the conditions are not met (define conditions by overriding).
      See Also:
      • Pet Newt's Hunt! effect can be triggered only if there is at least one player with a revealed Rumour card in their hand.

    • takeNextTurn

      protected void takeNextTurn()
      Makes the player triggering this effect take the next turn.
      See Also:
      • getMyself()
      • Player::takeNextTurn()

    • chooseNextPlayer

      protected Player chooseNextPlayer()
      Makes the player triggering this effect choose an adversary to play the next turn.
      Returns:
      The Player who was chosen to take the next turn.
      See Also:
      • getMyself()
      • Player::chooseNextPlayer()

    • getDescription

      public String getDescription()

    • getValue

      public int getValue()

    • getMyself

      protected abstract Player getMyself()
      Returns:
      The player triggering this effect : for WitchEffect, should return the accused player, whereas for HuntEffect, should return the the hunting player.

    • getTarget

      protected abstract Player getTarget()
      Returns:
      The player targetted by this effect : for most Witch? effects, should return the accusator, whereas for most Hunt! effects, should return the the hunted player.
